name: Prode
address: 251-28 Northern Blvd, Little Neck, NY 11362, USA

reviews.text:
Went there for dinner and honestly it was very sub par based off of the reviews. We ordered massaman curry, drunken noodles, and pork jowl over rice. Everything but the curry was barely warm telling me that it isn't made fresh and simply heated lightly in a microwave or something. The meat was to be supposedly grilled but has no flavor or texture, just that it was made prior and reheated in a microwave or something.
The atmosphere was nice and lively with a full house of people during peak dinner hours with no wait time. The service was a bit rushed but they were very  observant.
Prices vary based on the protein and is the usual you'd see all over New York. Portion sizes are average.
The food itself tasted average with nothing to note. The menu however doesn't reflect the actual item ingredients.
Taste soooi good. Definitely my favorite Thai near home.

10/19/25 - Update - I come to Prode Thai in Little Neck every year during my vacation, and itâ€™s always one of my favorite stops. The food is consistently delicious and full of authentic flavor. My absolute favorites are the crispy pork basil â€” perfectly seasoned with just the right kick â€” and the steamed whole fish with lime sauce, which is fresh, tangy, and packed with flavor. The staff are friendly and welcoming, and the service is always great. Itâ€™s a place I look forward to returning to every year!

A trip to New York would not be complete without visiting Prode Thai restaurant. The food they serve is among the best I have had in the city. Today, I had their Pad Thai, Larb, grilled pork, steamed fish with lime sauce, and baked glass noodles with shrimp. All dishes were prepared and seasoned perfectly,
Very delicious Thai food, Love the Thai tea

I really love coming here. The cocktails are so good , the staff is really great and most importantly the food is great. The quality of the ingredients is good so whether or not you want to brag that youâ€™ve been to Thailand and it doesnâ€™t meet your standards, itâ€™s still just an overall a wonderful meal . I love the larb salad the most

The foods are great and tasty. Crying tigersteak is delicious and it comes with the sauce and sticky rice perfectly. I love minced pork basil over rice  with fried egg and this dish is my favorite now.

Moreover, Duck pineapple curry is excellent with pineapple and lynchee which are good combination.

We get dessert aswell which is Trio topping with mango ice cream. They recommend to put peanut, plam seeds and cone with ice cream and eat all together. Whooo that is really good and  so yummy, freshly. ğŸ‘

Recommend it ğŸ‘

This was my first time dining at Prode, and it quickly became one of my favorites. Iâ€™m a big fan of duck, so I ordered the Pineapple Fried Rice with Duck and the Crispy Duck over Rice. Both dishes were excellent. The duck was perfectly crispy and flavorful. I also tried the Mango Crispy Fish, which was outstanding. I would highly recommend this dish to anyone visiting.
And of course, there are still many dishes Iâ€™d love to try. Iâ€™ll definitely be coming back again.

This restaurant is beyond amazing. The food is always delicious. The staff are friendly, efficient, and remember our names. The ambiance is gorgeous. Going to pride is like going to an upscale restaurant in the city- only itâ€™s right here in queens and the prices are reasonable.

I must say, this restaurant is definitely worth the drive! Everything here is perfectâ€”the decoration, the presentation, and of course, the food, which is absolutely delicious. The Thai flavors are truly authentic, and the desserts are just as delightful. My favorite: masaman curry

First time here. Service is great. Food is even better. Best pad thai I'd had in a while. Can't remember the name of the dessert, but it was a great new introduction

I've been back a few times more after my first time, and the food and service just keep getting better and better.
Delicious Thai food
Excellent everything and Delicious.
ğŸ‘ğŸ‘ğŸ‘

The Thai tea is so good! The I really liked the summer roll and the pineapple fried rice, and the Bangkok basil minced pork is amazing. The employees are very friendly. The atmosphere and decor is modern and clean.
The best thai restaurant in all of queens. it has the best service and best quality food in nyc.
This was the best Thai restaurant in queens, that Iâ€™ve ever eaten at.
very friendly and good costumer service

Food â€“ 3/5
Service â€“ 1/5

The food was okay, but definitely not the best Thai food Iâ€™ve had. The service, however, was terrible. No one came by to refill our water or take our orderâ€”we actually had to go up to the front desk to ask someone to come over. To make matters worse, they added a 20% service charge, even though thatâ€™s only supposed to apply to parties of six or more (we were five). After pointing this out, they did remove the charge, but overall the experience was disappointing.

If youâ€™ve ever had real Thai food - Iâ€™m talking about those hole-in-the-wall Thai restaurants with less than an A rating, or have been to Thailand, Prode offers dishes similar to what the country cooks but really catered to the locals.â€¦

Really nice restaurant. Very nice ambience and lovely decor. food was very good and price was reasonable. Nice service staff.  My only (very small) complaint would be that tables are kind of placed very close with each other.  so if another person has to sit next to your table, that someone will be squeezing through tight spot between tables and be real close to your food. Most people would probably be ok, I'm just bit sensitive on things like this so it did bother me just a little bit. Luckily I went during non-peak hours, place was half empty so I was comfortable. By the time I was leaving, place quickly started to get filled up and I imagine when it's full, it you don't like sitting real close to other people, it may bother you. I can sense that this place has become real popular, looks like lot of returning customers and I can see why as I'll definitely be returning too. Easy to find street parking near the place.

I recently visited this place with a friend. We originally planned to try their lunch special, but due to traffic we ended up going for dinner instead. We started with two appetizers: Thai dumplings and fried calamari. Both were delicious and generous enough to split between us. For mains, I ordered the crab meat fried rice, which was flavorful and satisfying. My friend went with the green curry chicken. She requested it mild, but it still came out quite spicy. She ended up ordering an extra side of rice to help balance the heat - though it came at an additional cost. To go with our meal, my friend ordered a glass of Prosecco, while I tried a cocktail called First Kiss, a fruity mix of different liquors. Both were enjoyable, but I found the drinks a bit overpriced for what they were. We finished with a unique dessert: a trio topping sampler featuring one scoop of mango ice cream with three toppings - nuts, corn, and palm seeds. It was refreshing and tasty, but again, the price felt high for the portion. We were charged $15 for the dessert, but when leaving, we noticed the paper menu by the door listed the dessert as $13. My recommendation is to update the printed materials so prices are consistent - otherwise, it doesn't look professional.
The atmosphere was calm, with quiet music by Pablo Cepeda playing in the background. It was pleasant and not loud, so we could enjoy our conversation and meal. Personally, I think Thai music would make the experience feel more authentic, but overall it was nice.
Service was excellent. Our waitress, Pang, was attentive, friendly, and quick to refill water or answer any questions. Even though the dining room was empty besides us (though plenty of people seemed to be picking up takeout which was a little bit distracting), she made us feel welcome and well taken care of.
Overall, I would recommend Prode to anyone who enjoys Thai food. The flavors were on point, and the service was great. That said, I do think the drinks and dessert were overpriced. Still, itâ€™s worth checking out and deciding for yourself.
Great food and good services, definitely recommended.
Food it delicious and staff very friendly I will recommend my friend and family to try again soon.
Real Thai food and the staff so good.
Great food and good service.
I recently visited Prode thai, It exceeded all my expectations. The staff were warm and attentive, the ambience was relaxing, and the food was simply outstanding. This is the good spot.
Good service. I very love this dumpling.
The food is amazing taste and the server very nice.
We love Prode! Everything weâ€™ve tried is better than the next and the drinks are absolutely amazing. Would definitely recommend!!!

Love the place always.

Love the vibe here. I especially recommend the grilled squid can't believe it was only $15. The Chili Lime Branzino was delicious! Definitely worth the 20 minute wait.

â€”â€”â€”â€”

Second time here and had the same great experience as last time!
We came in about 45 mins close to closing and still met with impeccable friendly service.  The food was amazing and we can't wait to come back
They have pretty good lunch special and we enjoyed it a lot. Portion can be better though.
This place is awesome.  Great service, great food!

We went to Prode for the first time recently and we loved it! Every dish was delicious. The crispy fish was fresh and garlicky in a tasty sauce. We also had noodles with squid which was very fresh. The owner, who is very friendly, says the squid not frozen but rather hand picked at the fish market.  Loved their Thai iced tea too which is served with the sweet milk on the side. So cute! Run donâ€™t walk to Prode. Itâ€™s a gem!

Everything about this place is awesome! Especially the service.
I had a server named Naw, and she was always ready whenever we needed her!
They also gave us 3 extra Thai teas! Theyâ€™re awesome
I like the fish, beef and manga salad! Pretty restaurant and reasonable price
Love the food!!! they have more menu options than other Thai restaurants. The restaurant decor is really clean, new and refreshing

My friend had highly recommended this restaurant to me several times. I finally got a changce to try it yesterday. I had to say each dish amazed our taste buds perfectly!!ğŸ¤©I definitely will come back again!

Went to this place on a Saturday night and honestly it was a mistake not making a reservation. It was super crowded but luckily after waiting around 5 minutes, we were able to be seated with the help of the staffs! We ordered quite a lot of food. I personally loved the crying tiger steak. It was marinated and grilled to perfection, a little red inside and super juicy. I really enjoyed wrapping the meat in lettuce and dipping it in the sauce. First time trying the Massaman curry and it was phenomenal too. I always like to end Thai meals with mango sticky rice and this one didnâ€™t disappoint. Also, all the staffs are super friendly. My friend and I really enjoyed the whole dinning experience there. Hope to come back again soon and try the fish next time!

Prode Thai Food in Little Neck is hands down one of the best Thai spots in the neighborhood. I tried their Tom Yum Stir Fryâ€”something Iâ€™ve never seen beforeâ€”and it was bursting with flavor. The lunch special came with a crispy spring roll and was a great value. The service was excellent, fast, and friendly, and the decor added a cozy, inviting touch. If youâ€™re craving authentic, flavorful Thai food in Little Neck, Prode Thai is a must-try.

This Thai restaurant is super authentic, with an amazing ambiance. I would definitely recommend going during lunch hours as they have a stellar lunch special. Every dish we ordered was spectacular although my personal favorite was the garlic noodles. I chose pork as my protein but my brother prefers the crispy chicken. Definitely check this cozy, local spot as you wonâ€™t be disappointed!

Absolutely loved this place! My boyfriend and I randomly discovered it while scrolling through UberEats, but instead of ordering in, we decided to check it out in personâ€”and it was the best decision ever! The food was phenomenal like, every bite was bursting with perfectly layered flavors that made our taste buds do a little happy dance. The service? So attentive and sweet, we felt totally taken care of from start to finish. Everyone was super nice, and the whole vibe just made the experience even better. 10/10 would recommendâ€”weâ€™re already planning our next visit!

I really like the atmosphere of this restaurantâ€”it makes me feel like I'm in Bangkok, Thailand. The dishes here are also authentic Thai flavors, and I highly recommend the  Spicy Tom Yum Soup and Crab meat Fried Rice . The staff are very warm and attentive. Highly recommended!
Great lovely restaurant. The food is amazing. We loved every dish. Will definitely be back soon. We especially enjoyed the warm service and beautiful decor. Great spot if youâ€™re craving Thai food

Absolutely amazing experience! Every single dish was incredibly delicious â€” full of authentic flavors and beautifully presented. The service was attentive and friendly, making us feel very welcome. The drinks were not only tasty but also stunning to look at. Highly recommend this place for anyone craving top-quality Thai food!

Went to Prode for birthday lunch & was not disappointed. We were really early & had the whole restaurant to ourselves. Everything we tried from the Thai ice tea to the crying tiger steak was delicious. The service was great & the ambiance was cozy.

Ratings:
Food-5
Drinks-4
Service-4
Ambiance-5
Overall 4.5

Went here for a birthday celebration and Prode was able to accommodate 10 people. I was definitely not disappointed. Service, food and atmosphere of the resturant was amazing. Prode has spice levels suitable for people looking for a flavorful spice to people who donâ€™t want tastebuds anymore. The drinks were delicious and presented beautifully. Definitely will return in the future.

Prode is a highly recommended Thai restaurant! From the decor to the dishes, everything exudes a high-end and refined vibe. The bar design is unique, with tasteful lighting and elegant arrangements. As for the food, the flavors are authentic, especially the Thai curry and Tom Yum soup, which are incredibly impressive. The freshness of the ingredients and spices truly stand out. The staff is friendly and attentive, making the experience feel welcoming and pleasant. The price is also reasonable, making it a great spot for a gathering with friends or a romantic date. Iâ€™ll definitely be back next time!

ğŸ› Prode Thai â€“ Little Neck, NY
â­ï¸â­ï¸â­ï¸â­ï¸â­ï¸
If you're craving authentic Thai flavors with a side of warmth and hospitality, Prode Thai is the spot. Tucked along Northern Blvd, this place is a hidden gem that blends upscale vibes with home-style cooking. The decor is sleek and cozy, and the food? Legit Thaiâ€”herb-infused, flavorful, and beautifully plated.
Now letâ€™s talk about Nawâ€”the host with the most. Naw is the kind of person who makes you feel like youâ€™ve walked into a friendâ€™s home. Friendly, attentive, and always smiling, Naw sets the tone for a dining experience thatâ€™s both elegant and welcoming. The entire staff follows suitâ€”courteous, knowledgeable, and clearly passionate about what they do.

Now letâ€™s talk food. We went all in and every dish delivered:
- Grilled squid â€“ tender, smoky, and perfectly charred
- Veggie combo â€“ fresh, colorful, and balanced
- Fried & crispy red snapper â€“ golden, flaky, and packed with flavor
- Spicy basil fried rice with shrimp â€“ and yes, the shrimp were huge
- Crying tiger steak â€“ a massive plate of medium-cooked beef that melts in your mouth
- Green curry with duck â€“ rich, creamy, and deeply satisfying
- Drunken noodle with fried tofu â€“ bold, spicy, and full of texture
- Bi Go Moi with ube ice cream â€“ the first time Iâ€™ve ever drooled while eating
- Yellow corner drink â€“ strong and smooth, according to my wife (she knows her cocktails)
The restroom? Fancy and beautifully done. The bar? Fully stocked with top-shelf selections. And the best part? No wait times. You walk in, you eat like royalty, and you leave wondering why you havenâ€™t been here sooner.
If you live anywhere near Little Neck, Iâ€™m challenging you to try it out. This place is a must.

ğŸ˜ BS â€“ basic (come on! Try harder)
ğŸ‘ BS + â€“ better (Yo! That's better)
ğŸ”¥ BS ++ â€“ best (alright! Alright! Alrightttt!)
ğŸŒŸ BS +++ â€“ Amazing location! now that's boomsauce!
Trust meâ€”I am vegan.

Itâ€™s a great Thailand restaurant which is much better than I expected. I will recommend it to all my friends. I like Tom Yum Soup so much. There are a lot of seafood in the soup and make it  so tasty. The fish is very fresh and full of limeâ€™s aroma. The fried shrimp cakes are very crispy. Itâ€™s my first time to try lemonade Thai iced tea. Itâ€™s so amazing. I will visit Prode again soon.
Amazing food and cute interior! Personally love the fries, itâ€™s tangy and spicy. We have been here multiple times already

Check out my full review on Yelp!

Absolutely phenomenal spot for Thai food! Very expansive menu with great options and prices! The decor is stunning and the food delicious!! I loved the Crispy Pork Basil and the Fried Calamari.

We also met Amy, one of the owners, who is an absolute sweetheart and checked in on us throughout the evening.

Overall, a fantastic spot for Thai food that I will revisit and I highly recommend!

Amazing Thai Food in Little Neck!

This restaurant is a hidden gem with authentic flavors and great service. We tried the Red Curry with Beef, Fish Mango with Red Snapper, and Crispy Pork Belly with Basil, all of which were absolutely delicious. The Stewed Beef Tendon Soup was warm and comforting, perfect for the cold weather.

For drinks, the Romantic Butterfly Cocktail was both beautiful and refreshing, and the Lychee Lemonade was the perfect balance of sweet and tart.

The staff was super friendly, and the atmosphere was cozy and inviting. Highly recommend this spot for a great meal with friends or family!

Date of visit is 3/21/2025.

Great Thai Restaurant along Northern Boulevard and Little Neck. Ambiance and decor is good, great staff as well. Parking is quite difficult during rush hour as it's street parking only. Recommend the grilled squid, Larb moo and Chicken Prikhing. They have a bar area as well. Casual vibe.

Their food is soooo good and authentic flavor, run by Thai people. The price is also very friendly, especially compared to the restaurants in Manhattan. We ordered so many dishes, but only cost $120. Favorite dishes are the chili lime fish and red curry salmon, fresh seafood and light for healthy diet. Most importantly, their environment is very clean (10 out of 10). Will visit this place often.
è¿™å®¶æ³°é¤çš„ä»½é‡å¾ˆå¤§ï¼Œå‘³é“æ­£å®—ï¼Œè£…ä¿®å¾ˆæ¼‚äº®ï¼ŒæœåŠ¡è¶…å¥½ï¼Œå¦‚æœä½ ä»Šå¤©ä¸çŸ¥é“åƒä»€ä¹ˆï¼Œè¿™æ˜¯ä¸ªå¾ˆå¥½çš„é€‰æ‹©ã€‚
A very nice experience overall.  Service was fast and efficient.  The food was delicious.   Itâ€™s a bit overpriced in my opinion.  But still very good place.

Our first visit to Prode proved worth the search for a parking spot.  The place was clean; the staff were friendly and efficient, and the food was excellent!
The fries shake was nothing ordinary.  The seasoning powder had a subtle spice that made my mouth burn only after the fourth fry!  The beef barbecue was good but I would have like more sweetness to the sauce.  The red snapper in Fish Mango (Fried fish topped with mango, red onion, cashew nut, cilantro with chili lime dressing) was crunchy from lip to tail.  My favorite!

The Thai restaurantâ€™s deep-fried red snapper was delicious. However, I think it would be even better if the sauce was reduced a bit so the whole fish isnâ€™t soaked in it. I found the fried rice and salmon to be decent. The Tom Yum soup would taste better if it were spicier. The grilled squid was quite tasty.

Hands down BEST Thai food in New York! This place is beautifully decorated. Food is flavorful and atmosphere is really nice. They have great selections of Thai food and EVERYTHING that we have ordered so far is absolutely amazing!! I am truly amazed by the authenticity and how great everything tastes!

You must order their crying tiger steak and grilled squid. These two are our most favorites so far!!

Totally recommend this place for a casual date night, a quick family meal, or a special celebration. We will definitely come back and try everything on the menu.

PS. Their mango and sticky rice is BOMB. Itâ€™s a must try!!

Updated 7/26/2025

Coming back here for lunch with family. There were about 3 tables today and one of the staff was very rude. My wife got the lychee lemonade drink and it comes on a board with syrups to add based on personal reference. After my wife added the syrup and drank a bit.  Out of nowhere one of the staff just came and took the cup to the side and take the rest of the other stuff away. She didnâ€™t say anything and we didnâ€™t ask her to come over. That was so rude. I never experience that in any dining experience.

The service 5/5
Atmosphere 5/5
Food 4.8/5

Was here for a quick dinner with wife and kid so we didn't explore the main much. Ordered 2 Thai ice tea. Normal Thai ice tea so not much to write. It's not the strongest but you can taste the tea.  We got the green curry and it's creamy. The chicken was a half chicken and taste very good. The pineapple fried rice was good, flavor was on point. The pad see you was great too. The cooking was very good. You have to try it.

This place is an authentic Thai culinary gem with a modern twist! The whole grilled squid is perfectly charred and paired with a signature Thai green chili sauce thatâ€™s simply amazing. The Chili Lime Branzino is fresh and meatyâ€”worth every minute of the wait. Add in the tangy Larb Moo, refreshing Papaya Salad with Raw Blue Crab, and the well-seasoned Bangkok Minced Pork Basil, and youâ€™ve got a menu that delivers on every level. With a chic, intimate setting thatâ€™s ideal for a date, this restaurant is a must-visit for true Thai flavor. Highly recommended!
Absolutely love this place! The Tom Yum soup is bursting with flavor, the crab fried rice is delicious with really large chunk of meat lol, and the Thai tea is super refreshing. Highly recommend!
